intro: Cota triumfetti subsp. briquetii, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
